intro: Lophiaris lurida, commonly known as the pale lophiaris, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
